extendedIngredients.name: low fat milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup low fat/skim milk (or almond milk)

extendedIngredients.name: milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: 45g | 1½oz (about 1/3 cup) milk or dark chocolate (chips, melts or squares)

recipes.title: Cappuccino French Toast with Coffee Cream
recipes.instructions: Whisk together the coffee, sugar and milk in a jug. Add the eggs and whisk again until well combined. Pour the mixture into a 9x13-inch shallow dish. Add 8 bread halves into the egg wash; divide the chocolate amongst the bread pieces and top each piece with remaining bread to make 8 sandwich halves. Leave to soak for 5 minutes on one side, then flip and soak for a further 5 minutes.Preheat a large nonstick pan, skillet or griddle with a light coating of butter. When hot, cook the french toast in batches until browned on both sides, cooked through and chocolate has melted in the centre.Meanwhile, make your coffee cream:Combine the cream, coffee and sugar in a medium sized bowl; beat on medium - high speed until cream begins to thicken. (Continue beating to make a whipped cream, or leave as a thinner cream to suit your tastes).To serve, drizzle french toasts with coffee cream; top with a scoop of ice cream (optional), and sprinkle with chocolate dusting powder.

steps.step: Whisk together the coffee, sugar and milk in a jug.
Add the eggs and whisk again until well combined.
Pour the mixture into a 9x13-inch shallow dish.

steps.step: Combine the cream, coffee and sugar in a medium sized bowl; beat on medium - high speed until cream begins to thicken. (Continue beating to make a whipped cream, or leave as a thinner cream to suit your tastes).To serve, drizzle french toasts with coffee cream; top with a scoop of ice cream (optional), and sprinkle with chocolate dusting powder.
